casebody.data:
UNITED STATES STEEL MINING COMPANY, LLC, Petitioner, v. James C. COCHRAN; Director, Office of Workers’ Compensation Programs, Respondents. No. 07-2133. United States Court of Appeals, Fourth Circuit. Submitted: June 6, 2008. Decided: July 14, 2008. Howard G. Salisbury, Jr., Kay, Casto & Chaney, PLLC, Charleston, West Virginia, for Petitioner. Frederick K. Muth, Hensley, Muth, Garton & Hayes, Bluefield, West Virginia, for Respondent James C. Cochran. Before NIEMEYER, TRAXLER, and DUNCAN, Circuit Judges.

Affirmed by unpublished PER CURIAM opinion.

Unpublished opinions are not binding precedent in this circuit.

*96PER CURIAM:

United States Steel Mining Company-seeks review of the Benefits Review Board’s decision and order affirming the administrative law judge’s award of black lung benefits pursuant to 30 U.S.C. §§ 901-945 (2000). Our review of the record discloses that the Board’s decision is based upon substantial evidence and is without reversible error. Accordingly, we affirm for the reasons stated by the Board. See United States Steel Mining Co. v. Cochran, No. 06-0948-BLA (B.R.B. Sept. 14, 2007). We dispense with oral argument because the facts and legal contentions are adequately presented in the materials before the court and argument would not aid the decisional process.

AFFIRMED.
